item.title: 帮助佛罗里达的 "飓风保险 "如何辜负了最贫穷的国家
item.description:
灾难债券已成为华尔街管理气候灾害风险的新宠。但是，当不幸降临时，它们可能会让脆弱的国家倒霉。【原文：

Catastrophe bonds have become Wall Street’s new favorite way to manage the risk of climate-fueled disasters. But they can leave vulnerable nations out of luck when misfortune strikes.

】

item.title: 泰国政府呼吁降低利率，泰铢涨势停止
item.description: 泰国泰铢本月的下跌引发了一种猜测，即随着泰国政府和中央银行之间的关系日益紧张，泰铢的涨势可能会结束。【原文：A decline in Thailand’s baht this month has spurred speculation that the currency’s rally may be ending as tensions grow between the nation’s government and its central bank.】

item.title: 为什么在股价屡创新高的情况下，回购对首席财务官仍有意义？
item.description:
此外，还负责管理与 Smurfit Westrock 首席财务官的合并。【原文：

Plus, managing a merger with Smurfit Westrock’s CFO. 

】

item.title: 美联储缩表疑虑重重，债券市场动荡不安，交易员防不胜防
item.description: 随着美联储降息路径的前景变得更加不明朗，债券投资者开始采取防御措施。【原文：Bond investors are going on defense as the outlook for the Federal Reserve’s interest-rate cutting path turns more uncertain.】

item.title: 阿根廷中央银行正在努力启用美元债务卡
item.description: 阿根廷央行行长圣地亚哥-包西利（Santiago Bausili）在 X 网站上发表文章称，阿根廷央行正与银行和信用卡公司合作，推出以美元计价的债务卡。【原文：Argentina’s central bank is working with banks and credit card companies to enable debt cards denominated in dollars, bank chief Santiago Bausili said in a post on X.】

item.title: 波音公司无休止的厄运循环让新任首席执行官奥特伯格无法喘息
item.description: 随着波音公司的危机接踵而至，这家陷入困境的飞机制造商却始终没有摆脱困境：它的困境似乎只会越来越糟。【原文：As Boeing Co. lurches from one crisis to the next, there’s been one constant for the embattled planemaker: Its predicament appears to be only getting worse.】

item.title: Stellantis 首席执行官称法国增税将损害投资
item.description: Stellantis NV 首席执行官卡洛斯-塔瓦雷斯（Carlos Tavares）说，法国提高企业税的计划将损害投资。【原文：Stellantis NV Chief Executive Officer Carlos Tavares said plans by France to raise corporate taxes will hurt investment.】

item.title: 南非国有企业：200 天未停电；卡车时代
item.description: 自 3 月 26 日国家电力公司 Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd.（Eskom 控股 SOC 有限公司）停止被称为 "减负 "的滚动停电以来，南非已连续 200 天保持电力供应。【原文：South Africa recorded the 200th day of constant electricity supply since state power utility Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd. halted rolling outages known as load shedding on March 26.】

item.title: 沙特人力资源公司的首次公开募股在第一时间得到全面报道
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，沙特阿拉伯人力供应商 Tamkeen 人力资源公司在周日开盘后的第一个小时内就获得了足够的投资者出价，足以支付其首次公开募股的全部费用。【原文：Saudi Arabia-based manpower provider Tamkeen Human Resources Co. got enough bids from investors to fully cover its initial public offering in the first hour after books opened Sunday, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 苹果公司的智能家居新战略屏幕无处不在
item.description: 在落后于亚马逊和谷歌之后，苹果公司终于准备角逐智能家居市场。此外：Vision Pro 团队在思考下一步行动；苹果智能公司（Apple Intelligence）的脚步越来越近；下一代 MacBook Pro 提前亮相俄罗斯；两位高管即将退休。【原文：Apple is finally preparing to compete for the smart home market after falling behind Amazon and Google. Also: The Vision Pro team ponders its next steps; Apple Intelligence approaches; the next MacBook Pro shows up early in Russia; and two top executives are retiring.】

item.title: Amundi 和 NWI 看淡美国投票焦虑，押注墨西哥比索
item.description: 从 Amundi SA 到 NWI Management 等基金管理公司都在对墨西哥比索进行逆向押注，在美国总统大选前汇市波动性有望回升之际再次介入。【原文：Money managers from Amundi SA to NWI Management are building contrarian bets on the Mexican peso, wading back in just as volatility in currency markets is expected to pick up ahead of the US presidential election.】

item.title: 迪拜对外籍人士的吸引力正在影响城市的基础设施建设
item.description: 上月底，迪拜大流行后的反弹程度显露无遗。就在非洲首富宣布成立家族办公室计划的同一天，桑坦德集团（Santander Group）成为最新一家在迪拜加强财富管理的公司。【原文：The extent of Dubai’s post-pandemic rebound was on display late last month. On the same day that Africa’s richest man unveiled plans to set up his family office, Santander Group became the latest firm to bolster its wealth offering in the emirate.】

item.title: 香港开发商的启德项目连续两周售罄
item.description: 香港最大的房地产开发商上周末售出了旗下一个项目的所有待售单位，因为一些买家利用了较低的借贷成本和大幅折扣。【原文：Hong Kong’s biggest property developer sold all of its units put on sale at one of its projects over the weekend, as some buyers took advantage of lower borrowing costs and steep discounts.】

item.title: 游说团体警告：英国天然气产量下降速度超预期
item.description: 据一个寻求政府救济以刺激投资的行业组织称，英国天然气产量的下降速度快于预期，导致对进口的依赖性增加。【原文：Britain’s natural gas output is declining faster than expected and leading to greater reliance on imports, according to an industry group seeking government relief to spur investment.】

item.title: 关键会议令中国不堪重负，投资者耐心面临考验
item.description: 周六，中国财政部举行了备受瞩目的发布会，但发布会的火药味并没有达到股票投资者的预期，这表明市场在经历了一轮举世瞩目的反弹后，其波动性很可能会持续下去。【原文：China’s highly anticipated Finance Ministry briefing on Saturday lacked the firepower that equity investors had hoped for, indicating that the volatility that’s gripped the market following a world-beating rally will likely extend.】

item.title: 澳门选举对赌场持谨慎态度的前法官为新领导人
item.description: 前澳门法官 Sam Hou Fai 曾对博彩业在澳门的过度影响提出警告，他被一个由 400 名成员组成的委员会选举为新的领导人。【原文：Former Macau judge Sam Hou Fai, who has warned against the outsize influence of the gambling industry in the city, was elected as its new leader by a 400-member committee.】

item.title: 中国通胀弱于预期，工厂价格下降
item.description: 中国 9 月份居民消费价格涨幅低于预期，而出厂价格则连续 24 个月下降，这凸显出需要进一步的政策支持来帮助经济摆脱通货紧缩。【原文：Chinese consumer prices rose less than expected in September, while factory-gate charges fell for a 24th straight month, underscoring the need for further policy support to help the economy break out of deflation.】

item.title: 欧洲央行将以意料之外的降息深化全球宽松政策
item.description: 欧洲中央银行可能将在下周推进全球宽松货币政策的步伐，进行一次降息，而就在一个月前，政策制定者还几乎排除了这一可能性。【原文：The European Central Bank will probably advance the global push for monetary easing in the coming week with an interest-rate cut that policymakers had all but ruled out just a month ago.】

item.title: 太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）早于预期获批飞行第五艘星际飞船
item.description: 太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）获得了美国航空安全监管机构的批准，发射其大型星际飞船火箭的第五次重要试飞；这是一次关键性任务，助推器部分将从太空返回，并尝试直立着陆。【原文：SpaceX received approval from US air safety regulators to launch the fifth major test flight of its massive Starship rocket — a pivotal mission that will see the booster portion return from space and attempt to land upright.】

item.title: 米尔顿事件后巨灾债券基金的风险溢价上升
item.description: 由于专门从事巨灾债券业务的资产管理公司对飓风米尔顿的影响做出了反应，发行巨灾债券的成本看来会上升。【原文：The cost of issuing catastrophe bonds looks set to go up, as asset managers who specialize in the securities react to the fallout from Hurricane Milton.】

item.title: 西班牙 Navantia 公司接近达成收购 Harland & Wolff 公司的交易：电讯报
item.description: 据英国《每日电讯报》报道，西班牙国有造船企业 Navantia 即将达成收购英国 Harland & Wolff 集团控股公司的协议。【原文：Spanish state-owned shipbuilder Navantia is nearing a deal to buy the UK’s Harland & Wolff Group Holdings out of administration, according to the Telegraph.】

item.title: 橙子种植者正在寻求转机。密尔顿来了
item.description: 飓风米尔顿肆虐佛罗里达州后，佛罗里达州的果园里橘子和一些柑橘树枯萎倒地，种植者们正希望这个陷入困境的产业最坏的时期已经过去。【原文：Oranges and some citrus trees are lying useless on the ground in Florida’s groves after Hurricane Milton tore through the state, setting back growers just as they hoped the worst for the struggling industry was over.】

item.title: 零售交易商押注波动性，迎接市场动荡
item.description:
美国股市正面临着来自多个方向的潜在动荡，一些无畏的投资者正涌向与 VIX 相关联的 ETF。【原文：

The US stock market is facing potential turbulence from several directions and some intrepid investors are piling into ETFs linked to the VIX. 

】

item.title: 中国经济学家希望采取更多行动应对通货紧缩
item.description: 中国进一步加大了对经济的支持力度，承诺为下滑的房地产行业和负债累累的地方政府提供更多援助。但官员们仍未说服经济学家，他们所做的足以战胜通货紧缩。【原文：China moved to further ramp up support for the economy, promising more aid for the slumping property sector and indebted local governments. But officials still haven’t convinced economists that they’re doing enough to defeat deflation.】

item.title: 中国称与欧盟在电动汽车关税问题上仍存在重大分歧
item.description: 由于在布鲁塞尔举行的八轮谈判未能就欧盟计划征收的关税达成协议，中国敦促欧盟不要与个别电动汽车制造商进行价格谈判。【原文：China urged the European Union not to conduct price negotiations with individual electric vehicle manufacturers, as eight rounds of negotiations in Brussels failed to result in an agreement over planned tariffs by the bloc.】

item.title: 伊拉克称其上个月石油产量低于欧佩克+石油生产配额
item.description: 伊拉克表示，上个月伊拉克的石油产量低于欧佩克+的石油生产配额，因为伊拉克希望更好地遵守该组织平衡全球原油市场的努力。【原文：Iraq said it pumped below its OPEC+ oil-production quota last month as it sought to comply better with the group’s effort to balance global crude markets.】

item.title: 华尔街周从城市厄运循环中拯救城市
item.description:
旧金山遭受了打击，但它正在回归的路上

。【原文：

San Francisco has taken hits, but it’s on its way back

】

item.title: 财报季拉开帷幕，交易员需关注五大主题
item.description: 财报季已经到来，美国股市在 2024 年狂飙 9 万亿美元的涨势或许正面临今年最大的考验。【原文：Earnings season is here, and the US stock market’s furious $9 trillion 2024 rally is facing perhaps its biggest test of the year.】

item.title: Intesa 将任命前宪兵将军为安全主管
item.description: 据报道，意大利最大的贷款机构 Intesa Sanpaolo SpA 发生间谍丑闻后，将任命一名前宪兵队高级官员担任首席安全官。【原文：Intesa Sanpaolo SpA, Italy’s largest lender, is set to appoint a former top official of the Carabinieri military police as chief security officer after a reported spying scandal.】

item.title: 英国金融科技达人推动政府支持增长和 IPO 梦想
item.description: 英国一些最有价值、发展最快的金融科技公司的高管警告工党政府，如果英国不能解决该行业的一些主要问题，包括他们所看到的股票上市和监管机构决策速度方面的挑战，伦敦可能会在金融科技领域落后。【原文：Executives of some of Britain’s most valuable and fast-growing financial technology firms warned the Labour government that London could fall behind in the fintech world if the UK fails to address some of the industry’s key concerns, including the challenges they see with share listings and regulators’ speed in decision-making.】
